website_summaries.verdict: A little smaller than some on the market, but a good value for the price.
pros: You can simply push this model, which makes is a great option for people without a lawn tractor
Rounded edges help keep smooth lines in your yard
Also connects easily to a tractor if you have one
Smaller size is manageable, but still heavy enough to handle a lot of unevenness in your lawn
Made of a heavy duty steel
Includes a scraper bar and hitch pin
cons: The 24-inch width is a little limiting, and makes this product not as heavy as others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: The roller arrived a couple of days ago. With rain forecasted for overnight tonight I decided to put it together today and get rid of some mole hills. Took me about 45 minutes to put it together, primarily because I was doing it by myself and also I misread the instructions. Having someone to help would definitely make this quick work to assemble. A lot of reviewers are complaining about the fill plug. I used a little bit of white lithium grease on the threads and had very little issue getting it to thread into place, using a pair of channel-lock pliers for encouragement. My one issue was that the "5/16" nuts were actually 1/2" nuts.
customer_reviews.author: KSquared

customer_reviews.title: Drum leaked - problem with threaded plug
customer_reviews.text: The welded joint around the fill hole leaked. Also, the fill hole threaded plug itself was VERY tight and difficult to turn into the drum. After emailing pictures, the manufacturer sent out a new drum and threaded plug and they were both fine. I was told to only screw in the plug part way so it just clears the side support rail and that the plug was designed like this to allow for wear. I'm not buying that answer and why isn't any of that in the instructions? Others have had the same issue with the plug - my opinion is this is a design and/or quality problem the manufacturer needs to address.
customer_reviews.author: Bruha48073

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, some room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be durable. I've owned this for over a year now. It make dirt flat and it was now all that expensive. Why not 5 stars? It could be better. Placing even cheap ball bearing on the axels would make this a MUCH better product and the fill/drail hole could be made with more precision so I don't need a wrench and many layers of teflon plumber's tape. But as I said it works and continues to work and the dirt got flattened and that is what matters most.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J. Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Missing components... can't use roller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product on October 1, 2018. As soon as I received it I had to go out of state for about a month. Now that I am back I decide to open up the box start using it! While assembling the roller I realized that i was missing 2 main components (the frame extension bar)... spent $100 on a roller that I can’t use due to the missing components. Think twice before buying from this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: If I could, I'd give this tool 6 stars.
customer_reviews.text: My Gosh! What a treat to get something that turns out to be of much better quality than I anticipated. It was delivered a couple of days early. Well boxed and secure. An 8 year old could easily read the instructions and assemble it. And my hat is off to the person who designed the packaging. The screws and bolts are packaged on a paper/plastic/sytyrene sheet with each component well-labeled and placed in the exact sequential order that it gets attached to the roller. And when I had a small issue, the customer assistance person came on the line within a minute and immediately, cheerfully, and helpfully resolved the question/issue. If I could, I'd give this tool 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jock Friar

customer_reviews.title: Super product.
customer_reviews.text: First, there is nothing to dislike. Yes, it did take me 30-45 minutes to put it together. I had all of the tools needed. That helped. I even had a pipe wrench that was needed to tightened the large plug where you put water in it. I have rolled my yard two times and it works great. Only problem, it takes a lot of push to roll it by hand. My yard is not perfectly level. Going up hill even a little is tough. But, I expected that. I could always go with less than a full roller. I will keep it full.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: One big flaw.. Bad thread in the barrel, can't secure cap!
customer_reviews.text: There people have a great roller with one big flaw. The damn cap that threads into the tank itself DOESN'T THREAD IN! quality control needs to fix this cause after 2 of these, they Both Had the same issue. I have been so busy I never returned the second one sadly and will be gluing to cap shut with a set amount of weight in it it seems. The issue is in the barrel part itself so it's not like you can just get a new threaded cap. Very disappointed in this company's quality control department....
customer_reviews.author: DecepticonJLU

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: This thing is seriously such a massive pain to put together, there are so many parts which could have been made to bypass this unnecessary suffering. The threads for the plug aren’t made correctly, so it won’t screw in very far at all. There was also plastic that I had to cut off on the part which attaches the handle to the barrel, otherwise the washer wouldn’t fit on. The handle just rotates with you when you’re trying to turn it, and the directions are confusing.
customer_reviews.author: mom2407

customer_reviews.title: Missing Components Makes For Useless Tool
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived on time and in good condition on Wednesday, 8/28/2019. The very same day I opened the package to find missing components. Missing where extension bars, handle, connectors/fasteners, barrel plug, and instructions. Only four out of what I believe should be eleven parts arrived. See images of package arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Beefy Poly Roller, but Plug will not thread into drum.
customer_reviews.text: It is an extremely tough poly roller, and the handle is pretty beefy as well. The fallback is the plug that holds the water in. It feels like it was cross-threaded from factory, and will not thread in more than 1 turn. This does not seal to hold water, and actually hits the frame of the handle and popping out if you try to use it as is. I hate to post such a bad review about something that seems so solidly built, but if it does not hold water then it is useless..
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with my moss lawn
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to press the moss onto the ground once in a while. This works perfect for this. (Without rolling the moss once in a while, the leaf blower will easily tear moss from the ground.) One time the "C" washer came off one end, but it was a standard size that our big box store carries. I use the model with the handles since the lawn is maintained by hand. (No garden tractors.) Really like it. Amazon is the only place I found a hand push lawn roller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is so difficult about throwing bolts in a box, but someone failed this simple task. Called customer service...closed. Not sure I want to wait two weeks or more to receive these, probably by ground. I've seen by reading other reviews that this seems to be a common problem. Missing parts. I gambled anyway, and here we are. :(
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It's not heavy enough to levelling my backyard.
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical since it can be used without a tractor/bobcat, and in the end, I was right: It didn't work. Unfortunately, I returned this product to Amazon, and I'll need to look for another option to levelling my yard since it's not heavy enough to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Michelutti

customer_reviews.title: Excellent roller!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase a push roller, but I do not have anything to pull this with. I finally decided to take a chance on this and I am glad I did. The poly roller material cuts off some of the weight, making this much easier to push. I have a small yard with some hills and with this full of water (250+ lbs), I had no issues pushing it up the hills. Now I can finally roll my yard again. I am so glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for landscaping! For years I have been trying to fill in low spots in the lawn and dead spots and I really struggled with a bumpy lawn. This roller help to flatten the lawn and when it comes time to reseed a new section of the lawn this is the tool to have! I don’t think that it was listed in the description but this is a tool that you can tow behind a lawn tractor or hand push
customer_reviews.author: Shomare

customer_reviews.title: Cap is a pain
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy. All parts were included. I do think the spacer (in Step 3) is shown in the wrong position as the written instructions, in Step 4, say bolts must straddle the spacer which they do not if the spacer is located as shown in Step 3. BIGGEST let down is the cap which is very difficult to install (took me as long to get the threads to mesh as it did to assemble the rest of it!! This is, in my opinion, a major flaw that should be easily corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This Brinly garden roller is a first class product...
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid gardener...looked at this model on about 5 different sites...This is EXACTLY what I wanted. The quality of this Brinly is quite amazing. I have already rolled my yard & got the Emerald Zoysia I have planted looking like carpet...It has helped me turn a bumpy lawn where I plugged the zoysia to a very smooth good looking carpet lawn yard. BTW Amazon beat the other sites prices by $40 for whatever it is worth...
customer_reviews.author: Lee fedornak

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiGh quality roller
customer_reviews.text: The Brimly roller was very easy to assemble with clear instructions and photos. It has very high quality components and hardware. Filled with water to an estimated 175 pounds, it was easy to roll, even manually pulling it up a mild grassy and loam covered grade. I kind of wish it had some kind of braking mechanism though. Holding it back when going down that grade was a challenge!
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Bad Plug Design
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a better rating if not for the threading of the plug. A note to the manufacturer, Perhaps a better material would solve the all too common issue that most reviewers commented on.
customer_reviews.author: Khatchig Chirinian Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and manually operate.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Brinly 270 lb lawn roller for the versatility. Tow behind lawn tractor or enjoy a great work out manually pushing. Found no issues with assembly. As noted in instructions and prior reviews the fill plug although not seated, surprisingly due to the tappered shape, does seal. This is with a majority of plug threads exposed. Overall 5 stars and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn't too bad. Maneuvering isn't too bad and it feels about like you're pushing two push mowers at once (though I am a bigger fella, fluffy). I would recommend rolling after a decent rain or watering your lawn prior.
customer_reviews.author: G. LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: 7 parts missing
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item online. When it arrived yesterday, I took off time from work, purchased other items for a landscaping project starting today, for which this roller was needed. As I began to put it together, I found that several parts (worth a buck or two, but not available anywhere else) are missing. Now I am waiting for whatever number of days it will take for Brinly to get this simple step done right.
customer_reviews.author: REader

customer_reviews.title: Rollin, Rollin, Rollin
customer_reviews.text: Good quality roller!! Flattens dirt, rolled roofing, smurf villages - perfectly. Takes a beating. 1/2 filled with water, I can pull off the bed of my pickup, let it hit the ground, and it rolls - no cracking or breaking. Well with the price!!
customer_reviews.author: MicPei

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sod roller for a project and Lowe's wanted too much and Home Depot didn't have any. To say that some assembly is required is an understatement. LOL The instructions are a bit lacking but I eventually got it assembled correctly. I like that you can fill it with water and empty it to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used it once so far on a sizeable job installing zoysia plugs and top dressing an existing zoysia lawn. It worked great and due to the fact that you fill it to get the weight required,when I was done transportation was easy. Only issue is the cap for the water is very hard to screw in... I'll update if anything out of the ordinary happens.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Pulls fine with light garden tractor.
customer_reviews.text: Used this with my John Deere L108. I didn't have any problems pulling this up and down hill. One section is about a 30% grade. However, on a slope you'll want some extra traction for your rear tires. I use terra grips for traction. To avoid tearing up my lawn. Which chains may do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had a new driveway
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to bank dirt up to a new tarred driveway that was quite long. This worked great. I like that it has a drum that we added water into to weigh it down then could drain it to store it away. Light weight when dry. Add as much weight with water or sand to suit your need. Good investment considering how much it costs to hire landscaping done!
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used for leveling off area prior to sod installment. This was my second purchase of this item. CAUTION - Do no leave water in the drum for a prelonged period of time as the hard rubber casing will settle making it unusable. Expensive lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: DONALD HULTEN

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to..
customer_reviews.text: It's a roller... it does that very well. Those having problems with assembly... well, they must have got a different one than I did. One thing... many have issues with the tight fitting plug. Probly because they think it has to be tightened all the way.. IT DOES NOT.. yes it goes in hard. just screw it in a little way, it will not leak..
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: A decent lawn roller
customer_reviews.text: This roller was easy to assemble and the hardware seems well made. The only negative is that the sides are designed to protrude outward - kinda cone shaped. As a result, you can not roll right up next to a fence or raised border. I had no problem with the screw plug - I coated the threads first with grease and carefully threaded the plug into the opening.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Well-built, you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I have been renting these from time to time over the years from a local home improvement center. Decided it was time just to make an out right purchase and I couldn’t be more happy. Great quality easy to use you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice roller arrived this morning
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 20 minutes to assemble. The instructions were very easy to follow and actually made sense. All the pieces were well made and once I had it assembled, it looked like a better quality unit than the ones I have rented in the past. Very happy that I finally decided to purchase one for myself. The best part was that it was made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good buy not great. Leaks.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very difficult to install without tools and an additional person. Get your wrench, needle nose pliers and a second person. The plug for the water clearly leaks and it’s pretty impossible to get in completely as mentioned by other buyers. It’s a good buy, but not great. Mine looked like it was pretty scuffed on receipt so I wonder if mine was a return and that’s also why it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousWilson

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a pipe wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Went to assemble the product and the fill/drain plug would not hand screw in more than two turns. Because of the nut size, an oversized crescent wrench would not work to screw the bolt in. I had to break out a pipe wrench to secure the plug. Not sure if assembly deserves the one star I gave it. The bolt should have threaded in easier by hand and then a wrench to tighten, but not a wrench after two turns by hand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Handles Slip Off
customer_reviews.text: The rubber slip-on handles for hand rolling don't stay on. They slip-off.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Barr

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with product except for handle
customer_reviews.text: The roller is easy to assemble and does the job. Filled with water in poly roller no worry about rust. Handle for using by a person not attached to a tractor is a bit week and not very secure, but works
customer_reviews.author: Judy A

customer_reviews.title: Good product would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good I've only used it manually so far for packing sand for laying down fake grass, be sure to tip it on its side to fill it all the way up. I used water in it for now. Takes a few times to go over it since it's not as heavy as some others.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob J Rosencrantz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and works great. Fill it up with water and away you go. This has been the year of the moles (another 2020 thing I guess) and this puppy flattens out their tunnels.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi

customer_reviews.title: Repackaged with missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to like or dislike. Unable to use due to missing parts. Obviously repacked incorrectly and without major parts.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good lawn roller for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good lawn roller for the money. If you treat the roller as described in the owners manual the lawn roller will last many years. If you don't read the manual and don't empty and hang roller off ground during non use, you should spend a lot more money and buy a large metal drum roller.
customer_reviews.author: John Montani

customer_reviews.title: Lawn Roller Review
customer_reviews.text: Appears TB ok, Just like the one I rented at The Home Depot. I haven't used much yet. What I know so far. The center scraper bar gets clogged with mud if the soil is too moist. the handle bar grips slide right off which caused me to fall when pulling almost 200 lbs.in soft dirt. would work better if heavier although I wouldn't be able to pull it if it were heavier. I had no problem with the plug once I wrapped the threads with two or three turns of silicon thread tape, using a large channel lock plier's. Good quality, good price, Should last a lifetime, Mine anyway. I recommend .
customer_reviews.author: CHUKAR

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design: Scraper Bar contacts/rubs against the roller (insufficient clearance)
customer_reviews.text: Scraper bar has insufficient clearance with the roller. Clearance needs to be a quarter inch more. This level of quality control is just not unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: we recently installed 1600 square feet of new sod. ...
customer_reviews.text: we recently installed 1600 square feet of new sod. After soaking it really well, we ran this over the area a few times and our new lawn is smooth and consistent. Next summer, we'll use it on the not-new lawn areas to remove some lumps and bumps. Yeah, it is heavy, but it wouldn't work if it wasn't. The only drawback (which has already been mentioned) is that the plug took forever to get on. The threads just wouldn't catch, even with a lubricant on it!
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it should!
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is with the T-handle for pushing or pulling this manually. It has a tendency to "loosen" up and then pivots making it harder to control while pushing or pulling Other than that, works exactly as it should!
customer_reviews.author: John Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job compacting soil.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product & does a good job compacting soil. I like the variability of adding or draining water depending on if it’s being used manually or towed. I plan to use it again soon on a rolled roofing project. The drawback is it’s very large & takes up a lot of storage space. Also, it’s not an item that will get much use again by the average person once you complete your project.
customer_reviews.author: KKB

customer_reviews.title: Great for prepping loose ground post till for sod installs
customer_reviews.text: The plug is a mother to get in. Don’t even bother trying with your delicate hands. You better let out a battle cry and come at it running with some large channel locks or will will die. Obviously, a 270# drum isn’t the easiest thing to maneuver around don’t ever think it will be. Don’t even try to push/pull this beast fully loaded by hand if you don’t lift, although this would be good for CrossFit.
customer_reviews.author: JLaCon

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality roller
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of property so this roller makes sense in so many areas. I use it for compacting gravel paths and lawn areas and leveling off damaged or flood prone areas. Perfect weight and seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Motola

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to assemble if there are two people
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble if there are two people, would probably be tough without help. The plug doesn't fit and the water leaks out slowly, a ltitle plumber's tape should hopefully fix the problem. Pulls great behind my mower.
customer_reviews.author: Bookgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these for our company. It is the only only one that I would consider. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Plug issue
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it on the lawn yet, but I just wanted to comment on the problem a lot of people seem to have with the plug. I had no problem with it. I did use a little plumber's silicone grease on it, and that might have helped. It may be that they have addressed the issue too, but I carefully threaded it in, and it worked just fine.

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use it but it seems to work great without water in it. Easy to assemble.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good not great. Only because the design of the fasteners and structure is for lowest cost. A few more dollars with focus on easy assembly would go a long way. The versatility of being able to pull it with a tractor or push by hand make it an easy choice. I’d buy again if needed
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie sweet

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Good instructions, Easy to Assemble & Quality Parts. Made in USA, was fearful of receiving other than USA made cheap parts. One recommended comment is to insure the bolts holding the hand handle are tightened very tight to prevent the handle from shifting during use. Was easier to move over newly installed top soil than anticipated, heavy but worked extremely well.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and a great value. Don’t fill it all the way and expect it to be East to move unless you’re part mule.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work good.
customer_reviews.text: Got ot today, put it together and rolled some resently filled low spots. Looks good!

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: It definitely flattens the ground when it is full of water. I can't wait until it rains again, so I can do the front yard and get rid of the valleys out there. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Winston-Salem

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to roll lawn after some major tree removal and backfilling. This roller did the job well, and regular use will help maintain a great lawn as long as I can still push it.

customer_reviews.title: Roller
customer_reviews.text: Did great on lawn filled with water to add weight

customer_reviews.title: Great product.

customer_reviews.title: Like the water tank version opposed to solid roller
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Wish all the hardware was rust proof. I like that is is light to store and easy to make heavy by putting water in roller tank.

customer_reviews.text: The roller is designed with nylon bushings/bearings for the axial, this will prevent squeaks and allow it to roll smoothly. The weight of the roller half full is perfect for leveling the bumps left from frost but not so heavy it compresses the soil.
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Lawn roller for a small area.
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy, but manageable. We have a smaller yard with a lot of landscaping cut outs, so this is perfect for tight areas and edges.

customer_reviews.text: I assembled it easily. I tightened plug with my hand enough to seal. Works great.

product_meta.description: Lawn rollers (also called sod rollers or yd. rollers) are ideal for erasing damage & helping establish new growth for a perfect, healthy lawn. Before planting new grass seed, a lawn Roller can help level uneven ground. After seeding, rolling helps speed up germination by ensuring that seeds make contact with the soil. Use a water-filled lawn Roller to help new sod get established, removing air pockets & ensuring roots make contact with the soil. If rodents & insects have damaged your grass, A lawn Roller helps smooth The lawn for uniformity. Indiana-based brinly-hardy company has been manufacturing quality lawn & garden attachments since 1839 taking the work out of DIY yd. maintenance only gets more effortless with each Brinly product in our broad line of durable attachments. The best yd. require the best tools-- get a yd. like the pros with Brinly!
feature_bullets: Push/pull combination: convenient push or tow-behind design provides versatility for rolling tight areas or larger open spaces. Perfect tool for erasing lawn damage from moles and frost, or packing down loose dirt, seed, or sod.
28 gallon capacity: sturdy Roller holds up to 28 gallons (270 lbs.) of water or sand is both light enough to push through the yard and rugged enough to withstand towing behind a tractor.
Durable construction: Sturdy poly roller drum won't dent or rust, and resists weather damage for use season after season. Measures 24" In width.
Faster filling: includes fill opening with extra-large diameter to expedite filling and emptying of the drum. Can be easily filled with a garden hose.
No-hassle storage: when you're finished rolling your lawn, simply drain and hang this compact roller in your garage or shed to occupy minimal space. Empty roller is lightweight for easy transport.
